description: Integer sided squares, no more than a(n) of any size, can tile the square with side n.
comments: Eves (2001) illustrates that a(175) = 1. - _Alonso del Arte_, Jun 17 2013
references: Howard Eves, Mathematical Reminiscences. Mathematical Association of America (2001) p. 78 Fig. 7.
example: a(7) = 3 since any tiling of a 7x7 square with integer squares has at least 3 of the same size.
author: _Erich Friedman_
